result.execSummary:
The defendant Wilder W Hoxie Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Wilder W Hoxie Jr is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Wilder W Hoxie Jr was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Wilder W Hoxie Jr was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Wilder W Hoxie Jr was found guilty of 4th Degree Sexual Assault [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).
  • Wilder W Hoxie Jr was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Wilder W Hoxie Jr was found guilty of Unlawful Phone Use-Threatens Harm [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.012(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.  Judgment of conviction prepared.
Status conference on March 27, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

AMENDED CASH BAIL - Conditions Modified -  $2,000 (previously posted)
- Defendant is allowed leave the State of Wisconsin to travel 
 - The Court finds that cash bond is necessary to assure the defendant's appearance in Court. Cash bond is set in the amount of $2,000 per case. If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with DCBM as a condition of the defendant's release. The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail.  Court orders to remove GPS but continue bail monitoring.
  If the defendant fails to comply with DCBM, a body only bench warrant shall be issued for the defendant's arrest and the defendant shall be held in custody until bail is reviewed by the court.
 - Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with H.E.H.
 - Any child visitation must be arranged and occur through a third party.
 - Defendant shall not be in the 5400 block of Allen Dr in the Town of Oregon.
 - Defendant shall surrender his passport to the court.
 - Defendant may leave the state for work purposes only.

Reporter: Melanie Nelson
Ct orders GPS removed - bail monitoring continues
